document.docAuthor: Seldon, David S. & Buckley, Thomas R.
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Mecodema Blanchard 1853 (Coleoptera: Carabidae: Broscini) from the North Island, New Zealand

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Mecodema Blanchard 1853 (Coleoptera: Carabidae: Broscini) from the North Island, New Zealand

subSubSection.paragraph: (includes new combinations of South Island only taxa).

paragraph.keyLead: - Ventrites 3–5 without setose punctures or with 1–3 setose punctures each side of midline........................... 5

2(1). Protibia ( Fig. 10 ) and mesotibia greatly distally expanded and distinctly inwardly curved..............................................................................................
M. antarctica Castelnau, 1867
,
comb. n.
- Protibiae distally expanded without inward curve, mesotibiae slender.......................................... 3

3(2). Elytra striae with numerous long setae in apical ¼.............................
M. tibiale Castelnau, 1867
,
comb. n.

4(3). Mesocoxa ( Fig. 2 ) with 1 setose puncture, metacoxa with 2 setose punctures.......
M. moniliferum Bates, 1867
,
comb. n.

- Mesocoxa with 2–3 setose punctures, metacoxa with 2–3 setose punctures..........
M. aberrans Putzeys, 1868
,
comb. n.

5(1). Elytra narrower than pronotum at the widest point........................................
M. chaiup Seldon, 2015
6(5). Ventrite 3 without setose punctures each side of midline..................................................... 7
- Ventrite 3 with setose punctures present each side of midline................................................ 18
- Mesocoxa and metacoxa each with at least 1 setose puncture................................................ 11

8(7). Number of submentum sclerite setae 2–4 (Little Barrier Is. only).................
M. haunoho Seldon & Leschen, 2011

- Vertex with rugose wrinkles.............................................
M. parataiko Seldon & Leschen, 2011

10(9). Prothoracic carina slightly crenulated (Great Barrier Is. only)...................
M. aoteanoho Seldon & Leschen, 2011

- Prothoracic carina without crenulations (smooth)...............................
M. kokoromatua
Seldon et al. , 2012

keyStep.keyLead: 11(8). Mesocoxa with 1–2 setose punctures, metacoxa without setose punctures...................................... 12
- Mesocoxa with 1 setose puncture (or absent), metacoxa with 1 setose puncture.................................. 16

paragraph.keyLead:
12(11). Prothoracic carina bearing 7–10 setae along each side ( Fig. 11 )...............................
M. atrox Britton, 1949
- Prothoracic carina bearing 2–6 setae along each side....................................................... 13

14(13). Prothoracic carina bearing 4–6 setae along each side....................................
M. curvidens Broun, 1915

- Prothoracic carina bearing 2–4 setae along each side........................................
M. perexiguus
sp. n.

15(13). Vertexal groove ( Fig. 9 ) narrow and shallow, broadened laterally (Poor Knights Is. only)..................................................................................................
M. ponaiti Seldon & Leschen, 2011

- Vertexal groove narrow and defined along the entire length..................................
M. pluto Britton, 1949

- Prothoracic carina bearing 2–4 setae along each side............................
M. manaia Seldon & Leschen, 2011

17(16). Mesocoxa ( Fig. 2 ) without setose punctures (Three Kings Is. only)...........................
M. regulus Britton 1964

- Mesocoxa with setose punctures (Cape Reinga to North Cape).....................
M. tenaki Seldon & Leschen, 2011

19(18). Pronotal disc with asetose punctures...................................................
M. florae Britton, 1949
20(19). Asetose punctures of elytral striae regularly spaced........................................................ 21
- Asetose punctures of elytral striae irregularly spaced....................................................... 23

22(21). Metacoxa without setose punctures, mesepisternum ( Fig. 2 ) with rugose wrinkles.............
M. quoinense Broun, 1912

- Metacoxa with setose punctures, mesepisternum with sparse punctures.....................
M. oblongum Broun, 1882

- Intervals 1–4 of elytra are flat or weakly convex...............................................
M. zonula
sp. n.

24(23). Asetose punctures of elytral striae are indistinct near suture......................
M. crenaticolle Redtenbacher, 1868

- Asetose punctures of elytral striae 1–4 are long and narrow...............................
M. longicolle Broun, 1923
25(18). Ventrites 3–5 with 2 setose punctures each side of midline.................................................. 26
- Ventrites 3–5 with 1 setose puncture each side of midline................................................... 27

- Mesocoxa with 2 setose punctures.......................................................
M. kokoroiho
sp. n.

29(28). Vertexal groove defined by punctures laterally only..........................................
M. undecimus
sp. n.
- Vertexal groove defined by punctures along the entire length................................................ 30

30(29). Pronotum foveae are deep and broad; prosternum with microsculpture/macrosculpture..........
M. validum Broun, 1923

- Pronotum foveae are shallow and narrow; prosternum without microsculpture/macrosculpture..........
M. papake
sp. n.

31(28). Pronotal carina with greater than 10 setae along each side......................................
M. argentum
sp. n.

- Mesepisternum with rugose wrinkles....................................................
M. ngaiatonga
sp. n.

36(35). Labrum ( Fig. 9 ) lobate with anterior edge distinctly emarginated...............................
M. dunnorum
sp. n.

- Labrum rectangular with anterior edge outwardly curved and slightly emarginated...................
M. tewhara
sp. n.

39(38). Submentum sclerite constriction narrow ( Fig. 12F ).........................................
M. dux Britton, 1949

40(39). Vertexal groove shallow and broad, without punctures........................................
M. xylanthrax
sp. n.
41(40). Vertexal groove with punctures distributed along the entire length............................................ 42
- Vertexal groove punctures distributed laterally only........................................................ 43

keyLead.keyStep:
42(41). Submentum sclerite constriction narrow.............................................
M. simplex Castelnau, 1867

paragraph.keyLead:
- Submentum sclerite constriction broad................................................
M. scitulum Broun, 1894

44(43). Vertex with fine lines forming an isodiametric pattern........................................
M. rusticulus
sp. n.

- Vertex with a few scattered punctures, surface otherwise smooth.............................
M. genesispotini
sp. n.

46(45). Anterior metaventrite process ( Fig. 2 ) with the carina width broad the entire length....................
M. kipjac
sp. n.

- Anterior metaventrite process with the carina width narrow the entire length....................
M. wharekahika
sp. n.

- Elytral interval 1 extended to basal margin only.......................................
M. spiniferum Broun, 1880

50(49). Mesepisternum with sparse punctures................................................
M. oconnori Broun, 1912

51(50). Elytral intervals 7–9 strongly convex, 7 th strial setal pattern with 3–4 setose punctures in posterior ½.......
M. tuhoe
sp. n.

- Elytral intervals 5–9 moderately convex, 7 th strial setal pattern with 5–7 setose punctures in posterior ½...................................................................................................
M. yconomus
sp. n.
